message: This is absolutely shameful. One of House Republicans first acts in the new year is to gut the independent ethics panel that acts as Congress' watchdog. So much for "draining the swamp."

Republicans voting to gut their own independent ethics panel reeks of politics at its worst and is the equivalent of the fox guarding the hen house.   Dismantling your independent watchdog committee isn’t ‘draining the swamp’ – it is Republicans shamefully acting to protect their own interests. http://bit.ly/2j4b2pV
It's an incredible honor to continue representing you in Congress. Thank you for your confidence in me. Looking forward to being your voice and fighting for Michigan in the 115th Congress!

Bad deals like NAFTA and TPP have undermined American workers. That's why I continue to oppose new trade deals if they don't give our workers a fair shake.  I'm ready to work with anyone, including President-elect Donald J. Trump, to promote trade policy that puts our workers first.   Read my remarks yesterday about the need for fair -- not free -- trade: http://bit.ly/2iIMTVj

Burying nuclear waste on the Great Lakes just doesn’t make sense and is too much of a risk to take, especially considering nuclear material remains radioactive for thousands of years. http://bit.ly/2iElwcG  Surely in the vast land mass that comprises Canada, there must be a better place to permanently store nuclear waste than on the shores of Lake Huron.

It is frustrating to see Governor Rick Snyder once again have no sense of urgency when it comes to the ongoing Flint water crisis. Right now, a common sense bill that would help prevent another water crisis is sitting on the Governor's desk awaiting action.  The Governor should sign this bill immediately – Michiganders are sick and tired of waiting for him to step up and help fix this man-made crisis he created in the first place. http://bit.ly/2iMlYI6

I am pleased to see Governor Rick Snyder sign this common sense piece of legislation into law today. Thanks for speaking up over the last 24 hours calling for action.  Hopefully today’s action will inspire a greater sense of urgency for both the Governor and the Michigan Legislature to pass additional state aid for the ongoing emergency in my hometown. Congress has acted on federal aid and now the State of Michigan, who created this man-made crisis, needs to step up to do more to help Flint families.   This crisis is not over. http://bit.ly/2iZeGhH

Every Michigander should be able to get quality and affordable health insurance to care for their families. That is what the Affordable Care Act set out to accomplish. The law is not perfect, and I’ll work with anyone – Democrats or Republicans – to make necessary changes to the law to provide better care.  What will not provide better or less expensive care, however, is repealing the Affordable Care Act in its entirety. That would do the opposite – raise health insurance costs, kick millions off their health care, and put insurers back in charge of patients’ health care.
In the richest country in the world, access to clean drinking water should be a right afforded to all, not a privilege for some.

Last night, President Barack Obama delivered his farewell address to the nation. Today, I spoke on the House floor to thank our President for his steady and strong leadership for our country over the last eight years.  Watch my speech below ↘

The U.S. should develop a comprehensive national plan to boost American manufacturing and stop the overseas outsourcing of good-paying jobs.  That's why I've co-sponsored the Overseas Outsourcing Accountability Act to help prevent companies from sending American jobs abroad.  Read more about the bill: http://bit.ly/2iHNTFP

Public town hall meetings like the one held tonight are important to providing transparency for Flint families. Ensuring residents have open forums where they are allowed to ask questions about the quality of their water will help to rebuild public trust as they continue to recover from this man-made crisis.   It is important to stress that this water crisis is not over. The state, which created the crisis, needs to step up and do more to help Flint families. The federal government, including the Obama Administration and Congress, has already stepped up to provide resources to replace lead pipes, expand health care services and provide nutritious foods to help mitigate the effects of lead. The Governor needs to act on more state aid for Flint.

Well-deserved recognition of Vice President Joe Biden's lifetime of public service!

House Republicans just voted on legislation to start the repeal of Affordable Care Act. I voted no because I'm strongly opposed to kicking millions off their current plans and putting insurance companies back in charge of your health care.  This apparently is the Republican health care plan for America ↘

My friend John Lewis has sacrificed more than Donald J. Trump ever has or will. It's a shame to see our President-elect attack a civil rights hero who was almost beaten to death on Bloody Sunday fighting for equal rights and justice.

People are speaking up, now more than ever, to demand health care as a right -- not a privilege only reserved for the wealthy. In the richest country in the world, families shouldn't have to constantly worry about being one illness away from bankruptcy or being denied life-saving care.  Everyone should have access to quality, affordable health care. Watch my interview from earlier ↘

Introducing my first bill in the new Congress -- it's focused on good governance and higher ethics standards for State Legislatures across the country.  Did you know that Michigan ranks dead last -- 50th of 50 states -- when it comes to transparency in government? That is unacceptable.  We can start to restore public trust in government by holding state lawmakers to higher standards. I haven’t met a single Michigander who believes Lansing is too ethical. http://bit.ly/2jrfzCk  Here's my plan to clean up state government  ↘
Today we honor and celebrate Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and his dream for America. Today and every day, we must continue to fight for a more just and equal society.

One year ago today, after 4.5 years of false imprisonment, Amir Hekmati was freed from Iran. I’ll never forget what it was like to meet him for the first time. I’ll always be grateful to all the people that joined me in fighting for his release.   It’s been so great to spend time with Amir now that he is free.  I feel like he's a part of my own family. One year later, his strength still amazes me. Looking forward to many more years of his friendship and watching his bright future! http://bit.ly/2iDO2g3

In order for us to be competitive in a global economy, we're going to need bold ideas to move our state forward.  I have lots of ideas on how we can improve Michigan's economy and invest in our people. That's why I've created a new Medium account where I hope to share my thoughts directly with you on ways we can tackle our collective challenges together.  Here's my first post -- Michigan has a real opportunity to lead the nation and offer two years of tuition and debt free college to our residents. This would not only ensure that workers get the on-the-job skills they need, but it would also ease the crushing financial burden of college currently on too many Michiganders.  What are your thoughts? I'd like to know. Comment below ↘

"Under Kildee's legislation, states like Michigan would have to adopt laws that promote government transparency by at least matching ethics requirements at the federal level. States that don't meet those standards would lose the ability to administer various federal programs. Instead, those programs would be managed by a correlating federal department."  Read my bill to clean up state government: http://bit.ly/2jrfzCk
Wearing red and standing in solidarity with educators and public school teachers today to say that billionaire Betsy DeVos would be terrible for America's children and our public schools!

Governor Rick Snyder has failed Flint families. It is disgraceful that a city of 100,000 people still doesn’t have clean drinking water and the Governor could barely devote two minutes of his State of the State to Flint.   Just two minutes dedicated to Flint? Really? This is an ongoing emergency– people in my hometown are still drinking bottled water and using filters. The Governor is either completely aloof or simply doesn’t care about Flint. http://bit.ly/2j7ja5n

"Michigan Governor Rick Snyder mentioned the Flint water crisis 34 minutes into his "State of the State" address Tuesday. For Congressman Dan Kildee, whose congressional district includes the city, that 34-minute wait was too long."   This is an ongoing emergency. Families are still using bottled water and filters. Where is the urgency by the state? http://bit.ly/2j7ja5n

I am deeply saddened by the passing of Lenore Croudy. Lenore was a passionate and devoted community leader and Flint will miss her dearly.   Jennifer and I extend our condolences to Lenore’s family during this difficult time. http://bit.ly/2iORjWR

I congratulate President Donald Trump on his inauguration as President of the United States. I hope that after a bitter and partisan campaign, President Trump will rise to the occasion and be a president for all Americans. http://bit.ly/2kaGdR0  Like many, I have continued concerns with President Trump’s rhetoric and temperament. Tomorrow, I will join thousands of Michiganders who are marching on Washington to speak out against the reckless policies President Trump has already prioritized that would take our country in the wrong direction. My constituents want me to hold the new President and Republicans in Congress accountable and I intend to do so over the coming years.

Trump has signed an executive order that means working families will pay potentially hundreds of dollars more out-of-pocket each year for their home mortgages. Trump's directive to halt all EPA grants and agreements may jeopardize much-needed federal funding, already passed by Congress, from quickly and directly reaching Flint families recovering from the ongoing water crisis. Given his campaign promises, and Congress already acting on relief for Flint families, I strongly oppose any actions by his administration that could delay resources getting to Flint. http://bit.ly/2kfzphC
Proud to be a Michigander every day. Wishing the best state in the nation the happiest of birthdays!

Thanks to Julia of West Bloomfield Township for telling her story about how her family, including her children — Eleanor, 9, Sadie, 8, Avery, 7, and Alice, 4 — all get their health care through the Affordable Care Act.  The ACA isn't perfect, and I'm open to working with Republicans and Democrats to improve the law. But repealing the law in its entirety— without any replacement — is irresponsible and dangerous.

It is no surprise that Governor Rick Snyder and I have had disagreements on policy, particularly on his handling of the Flint water crisis. But when it comes to supporting the Affordable Care Act, particularly Medicaid expansion like Michigan's "Healthy Michigan" program, the Governor and I agree.  Medicaid expansion in Michigan has worked. 646,745 Michiganders have affordable health insurance through this expansion thanks to Obamacare.  I will work with anyone, including Governor Snyder, to make sure that Republicans in Congress do not repeal affordable health insurance for Michigan families offered under the Affordable Care Act.

This is morally wrong and not consistent with our American values. Such a blanket policy stigmatizes an entire religion and casts doubt upon thousands of peaceful Muslims in Michigan who are our neighbors, co-workers and friends. Counterterrorism experts have voiced concern that such bans are a powerful recruiting tool for terrorists trying to do us harm. President Trump’s policy could make America less safe.‎  Right now, refugees from all countries undergo thorough security screenings before they are allowed into the U.S., including screenings by counterterrorism, FBI, Homeland Security and Department of Defense officials. This rigorous security assessment includes fingerprinting, background checks and in-person interviews. In total, this process takes up to two years to ensure that refugees entering the U.S. have been thoroughly vetted.  We must also remember that refugees who are fleeing their homes— overwhelmingly women and children — are victims of terror themselves. With vigorous safeguards I know that we can both protect the security of Americans while honoring our country’s values to help the vulnerable and oppressed. http://bit.ly/2kEijJI
This is not who we are as a country. We are better than this.

In a joint statement, Dan Kildee, Congressman John Conyers, Jr., Rep. Debbie Dingell slammed Trump’s directive as a “thinly veiled ban on entry based on religion."  “As members of Congress, we take a back seat to no one in our nation’s efforts to combat the ongoing threat of terrorism. That is why our refugee system already extensively vets and confirms every individual seeking entry to our country, subjecting them to a series of security screenings and checking against multiple law enforcement databases. But giving in to our worst fears -- as this order does -- will do nothing to make America safer or weaken our adversaries.”

Hardworking families deserve to know that when they get sick, they will have access to quality health care and affordable prescription drugs. Burying nuclear waste less than a mile from Lake Huron -- as Canada is considering -- just doesn’t make sense and is too much of a risk to take.  Proud to lead 23 Members of Congress today -- Democrats and Republicans -- in calling attention to this threat to our Great Lakes. Canada should consider a different location for a site.  Surely in the vast land mass that comprises Canada, there must be a better place to permanently store nuclear waste than on the shores of Lake Huron. Read our latest action: http://bit.ly/2kTFBwc

My constituents are very opposed to Canada permanently storing nuclear waste less than a mile from Lake Huron.  So far, 186 local, county and state governments representing nearly 23 million people in the U.S. and Canada have passed resolutions opposing the proposed nuclear waste repository.   Learn more about our bipartisan efforts to stop this plan and protect the Great Lakes: http://bit.ly/2kTFBwc

I am beyond disappointed to see Betsy DeVos become our next Education Secretary. It’s also no coincidence that Betsy and the DeVos family have donated hundreds of thousands of dollars to many of the Senators who just voted to give her this job. Like many Michiganders, I have fond memories spending time up north on Michigan's Great Lakes or beautiful rivers like the Au Sable. Our water is precious, and our state's economy relies on it, so we must always protect it from harm.  I'm unveiling new legislation today in Fenton to protect Michigan's water resources from a new threat: for-profit commercial fishing, commonly known as aquaculture. Watch live:

Whether it's invasive species like Asian Carp, Canada’s plan to store nuclear waste on Lake Huron, or the threat of commercial fish farming, I will always fight to protect Michigan’s Great Lakes and rivers -- our economy and jobs depend on it.  Read my new legislation that would ban harmful aquaculture practices in both the Great Lakes and federally-recognized rivers, including the Au Sable River ➡️  http://bit.ly/2kwiEkI

The doctor, whose report in September 2015 showed elevated blood lead levels in Flint children, penned an op-ed about her upbringing as the child of Iraqi immigrants." http://nyti.ms/2kZGZxT

My new legislation would address harmful commercial fish farming practices – known as aquaculture – that are a threat to both the Great Lakes and federally designated “Wild and Scenic Rivers,” including the Au Sable River. Aquaculture, if not done correctly, can lead to pollution, disease and invasive species.  Sadly, other states have seen aquaculture pollute waterways, subsequently crippling local economies. A commercial fish farm facility in Pennsylvania on Big Spring Creek – once a famous trout stream – collapsed the region’s fishing industry in the 1970s. We can't let that happen to our $4 billion fishing industry in Michigan that drives our economy and supports thousands of jobs. http://bit.ly/2kwiEkI
It is wrong that the Governor is ending water bill credits. This crisis is not over and Flint families need the state to step up and do more. http://bit.ly/2kkN7Uj

I will fight these careless cuts to Great Lakes protection efforts in every way that I can.

Cutting the Great Lakes protection efforts by 97 percent, including funding to combat invasive species like Asian Carp, would put the world’s largest freshwater supply and our way of life at risk.   Protecting the Great Lakes has never been a partisan issue and it shouldn’t be now under a new administration. http://bit.ly/2ln3znC

President Trump wants to slash funding to protect our Great Lakes from invasive species like Asian Carp by 97 percent so he can spend $54 billion more on the military. His proposed budget is reckless and dangerous.

After his first ban was unanimously blocked by federal judges, the President is attempting to repackage the same unconstitutional and un-American policy under the disguise of a new order.   This ban will make America less safe.   Even the President’s own Department of Homeland Security disputes the effectiveness of such a ban, saying that banning people based on where they are from is ‘unlikely to be a reliable indicator of potential terrorist activity.’ http://bit.ly/2lTFmS2

There's no shortage of issues that Democrats and Republicans disagree about. Thankfully, protecting the Great Lakes isn't one of those issues.  Read my piece in The Hill about why both parties should oppose a 97 percent cut proposed by the President to Great Lakes protection efforts ➜ http://bit.ly/2mUE11i  Simply put, our livelihood, our jobs and our way of life depends on having clean and vibrant Great Lakes. We must protect them from harm.

After what happened to my hometown of Flint, we must update federal law to provide greater transparency for families. Revising the outdated Lead and Copper Rule and lowering the action level of lead allowed in drinking water will not only protect public health, it will also restore public confidence in our water systems. That's what my new legislation, the NO LEAD Act, seeks to do.  We must learn from the failures of government that lead to the Flint water crisis to prevent a similar man-made emergency from happening elsewhere. Read my bill: http://bit.ly/2oEZVXm
I will fight the President's cuts to our Great Lakes in every way that I can.

Proud to stand with small business owners as we fight together to stop cuts to Great Lakes protection efforts.  The Great Lakes Restoration Initiative supports thousands of Michigan jobs. Our Great Lakes are huge job creators and that's why we must protect them from harm. http://bit.ly/2nhW51c

Public pressure -- in both the U.S. and Canada -- is growing to this dangerous nuclear waste site. Your voice is making a difference. This fight is not over -- continue speaking out.  Burying nuclear waste less than a mile from Lake Huron just doesn’t make sense. http://bit.ly/2oJbQCU

I sent a letter today to the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality voicing my strong opposition to Nestlé dramatically increasing its water withdrawals from a well in Osceola County.  I support any company creating jobs in our state, but not at the cost of damaging our environment and depleting our state’s water resources. It's unfortunate that corporations are more concerned with their own profits than with protecting natural resources that support our state’s economy, jobs and way of life.

Did you know that the Great Lakes: ➜ Support over 800,000 jobs in Michigan ➜ Generate $60 billion in annual wages to workers ➜ Provide drinking water for 48 million people  We cannot put our Great Lakes in jeopardy – our jobs, our livelihood and our way of life are at stake.

About 66% of the Bay Area Women's Center's annual budget relies on federal grants under the Violence Against Women Act. Under President Trump's budget, these grants could be cut, which could eliminate programs at the women's center to assist victims of domestic and sexual abuse.  I will fight these extreme cuts in Congress.
Nestlé wants to pump 400 gallons of groundwater a minute out of Michigan. I say no way! We shouldn't be draining our water so that a big corporation can increase its profits. http://bit.ly/2oysG6V

I’m proud to have worked in Congress to expand Head Start and Early Head Start for Flint families, especially in the wake of the water crisis.   We’ve successfully fought for millions in federal resources to support new and expanded Head Start. I had the chance to visit some of the kids who have benefited from these programs and see the great work their teachers do in our community every day.   Early education is important for all children, but such programs are especially important right now in Flint, as they can help to mitigate the effects of lead exposure.

Very pleased to join with the Genesee Intermediate School District and announce that the U.S. Army Junior Reserve Officer Training Program will be coming to Genesee County!  This successful program, a partnership between the Army and local high schools, will be open to students and focus on leadership training and helping prepare youth for a successful future. I am confident that the skills and training taught through this program will greatly benefit students and families in our community!

Unless Congress acts by Friday, the federal government will shut down. I strongly oppose this because it will hurt our economy, punish our seniors and veterans, and potentially cost taxpayers billions of dollars.  Michiganders overwhelmingly want Congress to do its job and pass a responsible budget to keep the government open. http://bit.ly/2pt5xEE

A long post on an important topic. I hope you'll take a minute to read:  Unfortunately, the House Committee on Financial Services today started the process of repealing Wall Street reforms that were put in place to prevent another financial crisis like the one we saw in 2008.  I'm opposed to repealing these reforms on Wall Street. It is the wrong choice for middle class Michiganders because it would take us back to the dark days when abusive Wall Street practices nearly crippled our economy. Back to the days when millions of people lost their homes, lost their jobs and saw their 401(k) retirement savings wiped out.   My constituents are still feeling the effects of Wall Street's greed. The financial crisis hit our state especially hard. Many Michigan families’ homes are still worth less than before the recession. Today, according to the U.S. Census Bureau, Michiganders own fewer cars, earn less money, and work fewer hours than before the financial crisis.  I have a simple question for my Republican colleagues who are pushing this terrible plan to repeal Wall Street reforms: have you forgotten the lessons of the financial crisis? We cannot turn a blind eye to the continued economic pain for so many American families. It is an absurd idea that we would put Wall Street back in charge of policing itself. It's foolish for us to reinstate big bank bailouts. This bill is a recipe for disaster. It puts our economy at risk and is the wrong direction for our country.  Here's my comments in committee against this terrible plan. I hope you'll take a minute to watch and share.

It was great to be back in Oscoda last week talking directly with constituents about issues on their mind. You can read more about our day in the Oscoda Press:  "Kildee has a special interest in preserving the waterways of the region, having spent a good part of his childhood camping in East Tawas City Park, where his family had a trailer permanently stored at the park. He said he remembers fishing and also watching B052s at WAFB."
"Flint residents are fighters, and many are beginning to see signs of hope for a better future."

Great news: A budget deal reached in Congress rejects President Trump’s proposed cuts to Great Lakes protection efforts! The President had wanted to cut $50 million from the Great Lakes to pay for a border wall between U.S. and Mexico. Thousands of Michiganders spoke out against these terrible cuts.  The Great Lakes Restoration Initiative has always had bipartisan support because it helps to protect the Great Lakes from harm, including from invasive species like Asian carp and pollution. It is vital that we protect the Great Lakes, now and in the future, because they help to propel our economy and support 1.5 million jobs.

Here's 17 photos that capture why I'm fighting President Trump's budget cuts to Great Lakes protection efforts. Under the President's budget, the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative would be eliminated starting next year.  If we put the Great Lakes in jeopardy, our jobs, our livelihood and our way of life are at risk.

Today the House Committee on Financial Services is considering legislation to get rid of reforms on Wall Street that were put in place to prevent another financial crisis. The "Great Recession", caused by big bank greed, hit our state especially hard -- many Michigan families lost their jobs, were evicted from their homes, and saw their retirement savings wiped out. Today, almost a decade after the financial crisis, too many Michiganders have not fully recovered and are still struggling to make ends meet.   Simply put, this terrible bill puts Wall Street before Main Street and I'm fighting against it. Here's why:

Flint families should not have to pay for water that they still cannot drink, and they certainly should not lose their homes over this ongoing water crisis that was caused by the callous decisions of state government.  It's unfortunate that Gov. Snyder ended water credits for Flint families. I opposed this decision because Flint families deserve support until there is confidence in the water system. http://bit.ly/2pIHpgr

This is despicable. If Republicans don’t want to be in their own health care plan, why are they pushing it on your family?   Congress should get no special treatment whatsoever. Trumpcare is a dangerous and reckless plan that will cost lives.

I voted no on the Republican health care bill -- Trumpcare -- because it forces families to pay higher costs for worse health care. It is absolutely heartless that 24 million people will lose insurance under this plan. My statement: http://bit.ly/2pKy5q8

It's not right that Flint families are facing foreclosure because of unpaid water bills for water that they couldn't drink.  They deserve support from the state of Michigan until there is confidence in the water system again.

We cannot forget the lessons of the financial crisis that caused so much economic pain for Michigan families. Putting Wall Street back in charge of regulating itself puts our economy at risk and is simply the wrong direction for our country.

It is time for all Members of Congress -- Republicans and Democrats -- to put country before party. We need an independent and bipartisan commission to look into the troubling ties between President Trump and Russia.  This is about protecting our democracy.

I come from Flint— we’ve seen the consequences of bad trade deals like NAFTA. For far too long, the game has been rigged in favor of corporations and against hardworking Americans.  Saying we are going to renegotiate trade deals is not enough—details matter.  I want to work with the President to make the process more fair for American workers. President Trump is failing to address one our country’s most pressing threats: climate change. Military and defense experts have concluded that climate change represents a major risk to our national security and have urged the President to develop a comprehensive strategy to address it. Instead, President Trump has dangerously decided to pull America out of the Paris Climate Agreement that seeks to address climate change, jeopardizing our domestic security and putting us at odds with our allies around the globe.  We have a moral responsibility to recognize that climate change is real and requires urgent action. We cannot afford to pretend that climate change is not real. The effects of climate change are evident all around us: surging asthma rates, deadly floods and droughts, and rising sea levels. To deny these effects of climate change on our children and communities will prove to be a grave mistake.  Climate change is also a real threat to the Great Lakes. In addition to current threats like pollution and invasive species, climate change presents new stressors for the Great Lakes. They could forever change if we allow climate change to deplete Great Lakes water levels and increase water temperatures, changing not only habitats and ecosystems, but also jeopardizing our jobs and economy that relies on our water resources.

Had a wide-ranging discussion on Morning Joe about many important issues facing our country, including preserving Medicare and Social Security, repairing our crumbling roads and bridges, investing in America's cities and towns, and protecting the Great Lakes.  Hope you'll take a minute to watch and let me know your thoughts below!

Big bank profits were $171 BILLION last year. It seems that Wall Street is doing just fine. So I ask: what about Main Street?  Republicans this week are trying to repeal financial reforms put in place after the 2008 financial crisis. Their policies would bring back 'too big to fail' for big banks and put taxpayers on the hook for more bailouts. I say no way.

I remember the 2008 financial crisis, including the millions of people who lost their jobs, their homes and their life savings because of Wall Street greed. Many communities and families I represent still haven’t recovered from the Great Recession.   That’s why I’m fighting against a bad piece of legislation in Congress that would undo reforms on Wall Street and mean you, the taxpayer, could be once again bailing out big banks if they go belly up.   This bill has nothing to do with creating jobs or growing our economy. All it does is give another big gift to Wall Street.   I hope you take a minute to learn about this ‘Wrong Choice Act’ and share it with your friends→
Pausing today to remember the 49 innocent people who were tragically killed on this day last year in the Pulse attack in Orlando.

Grass carp are one of the four invasive species of Asian carp that pose an urgent threat to the Great Lakes and coastal wetlands. That's why Democrats and Republicans in Congress are calling for more urgency to address their spread in the Great Lakes.  Billions of dollars of annual economic activity and hundreds of thousands of jobs are directly tied to the health of the Great Lakes and its wetlands. We must protect them from invasive species. http://bit.ly/2ro4eTW

Fact: Over 800,000 Michigan jobs in the boating, tourism and fishing industry are in jeopardy if the Great Lakes were to become contaminated with pollution or invasive species.  That's why I'm concerned about President Trump's $300 million cut to efforts protecting the Great Lakes. Those cuts jeopardize our economy, our livelihood and our way of life. It's too much of a risk to take.
I was at practice for the Congressional Baseball Game on another field when we learned of this terrible shooting. Praying for Congressman Steve Scalise, staff and U.S. Capitol police who were shot.

My hope is that this week's tragic shooting serves as a call to action for Members of Congress and all Americans to promote more civility in our politics, even when we disagree. The Congressional Baseball Game for Charity last night, where we came together to raise $1.5 million for charity, is a start.  I shared some of my thoughts about toning down political speech with CNN. Read them here: http://cnn.it/2s2NoNU
This is terrible news. Our thoughts are with the police officer hurt at Bishop International Airport. Jennifer and I are praying for the officer's recovery.

This violent attack on a police officer at Bishop International Airport is shocking and horrific. The FBI and other law enforcement agencies continue to investigate this as an act of terrorism in our community.   Our thoughts and prayers are with the injured officer, Lieutenant Jeff Neville, and his family. Jennifer and I join all Michigan residents in praying for Lieutenant Neville’s full recovery.

JUST IN: Senate Republicans have introduced their health care bill, and it’s not good for working people. It’s just as bad, if not worse, as the House-passed version of Trumpcare.   Millions will lose insurance, and many others will pay higher premiums for worse care. If you’re an older American, you’ll be forced to pay an ‘age tax’ on premiums and prescriptions, and if you have a pre-existing condition, insurance companies may not cover the cost of your care. Republicans want to make all of these bad changes to your health care to give another massive tax break for millionaires.    I’m opposed to the Republican health care plan and I’m explaining why now. Please stay safe, everyone!  Please review tips from FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency about floods: https://www.ready.gov/floods

I am pleased an agreement has been reached to stop illegal Mexican dumping of foreign sugar here in the U.S. Family farms in Michigan are struggling to compete due to unfair trade policies by Mexico and this agreement will help provide relief.

Senate Republicans have delayed a vote on their health care bill! Your calls and stories are making a difference. But make no mistake about it-- Trumpcare is not dead.   We have to keep talking about the disastrous effects of this bill: higher costs, worse care and 22 million Americans losing their insurance, all to give billionaires another massive tax break.  I am committed to working with anyone to improve health care in America. But crafting a bill in secret behind closed doors, with no hearings or public input as Republicans did, is not the way to do it. Let's work together to improve the Affordable Care Act, lower costs and improve care.

Women make up half of America’s workforce, yet only make up 26 percent of workers in science, technology, engineering and math occupations. That’s why I’ve introduced legislation to close that gap – which is critical to growing our economy.   Why? Because STEM jobs growing three times as fast as non-STEM jobs, and also pay more compared to other jobs. Thus, making sure that we have workers – both men and women – ready for these jobs will help us compete in a global economy.  Learn more about my legislation→ http://bit.ly/2tsaaAg

"Often overlooked by travelers heading north, Michigan’s “Sunrise Coast” offers a Great Lakes setting with a beauty all its own. From M-55 in Tawas City, M-23 skirts the Lake Huron shoreline through the coastal villages of Oscoda and Harrisville on its way north to Alpena. Pack a picnic and enjoy the scenery at Alpena’s waterfront park adjacent to the marina on the shores of Thunder Bay. Harrisville State Park offers campsites directly on Lake Huron. Even before the water crisis, Flint faced unique challenges as an older, industrial city: globalization, population loss, the outsourcing of jobs and blight. Flint isn’t an anomaly; a whole subset of America’s cities and towns face similar challenges. There are places in every region of the country, like Flint, that face similar stressors.  We can't forget about these places. America needs cities and towns like Flint to succeed. That's why I'm starting a new congressional forum to rethink how we approach and invest in America’s older, industrial communities.  Learn more about my new initiative→ http://bit.ly/2ue9q2t

I am pleased the House has passed my amendments, supported by Republicans and Democrats, to help veterans exposed to harmful PFCs receive the medical attention they need.  The United States Air Force and the Department of Defense must do more to address harmful chemicals like PFCs, including caring for both veterans exposed to these toxic substances as a part of their service and residents like those in Oscoda living near military bases who now have contaminated drinking water.  Read more about my legislation included in the National Defense Authorization Act: http://bit.ly/2tbyrer

It is long past time for us to have a national strategy about how we approach and invest in America’s cities and towns. That’s why I launched a new forum to change the way Congress thinks about places like Flint, Saginaw and Bay City. America needs these communities to succeed.  Learn more about our new efforts:

"Rep. Kildee’s new forum will include policy discussions in Washington, D.C., and in other communities across the country, along with local, state and federal elected officials and public policy experts. Kildee for his vision in this initiative."  Read about my effort to get Congress to focus on communities like Flint, Saginaw and Bay City: http://bit.ly/2ufWHvc

"Let Obamacare fail" is not a plan or leadership. The Affordable Care Act is not perfect (no law is), but intentionally sabotaging our nation's health care system means that people will suffer.  Democrats are ready to work with Republicans to fix the current health care system. I have proposed changes to help lower costs and improve access to care. Veterans should not lose their G.I. benefits because a for-profit school closes through no fault of their own. Yet when ITT Technical Institute abruptly closed its doors last year, it put thousands of student veterans at risk of losing their educational and housing benefits.  I'm glad the House unanimously approved my legislation this week to ensure that veterans keep their G.I. benefits they have earned. Read more about my bill: http://bit.ly/2tWy7fc

During the campaign, then candidate Trump came to Flint and promised to fix the water crisis. I took him at his word. So after the election, I wrote to President-elect Trump in January asking him for a point person in his administration that I should work with on Flint's recovery.  194 days later, I'm still waiting for a response from President Trump. During the Obama Administration, I worked almost daily with a point person, Dr. Nicole Lurie, and federal agencies, many of whom were on the ground helping Flint families. We also got Congress to pass $100 million in aid for Flint last year that was signed into law by President Obama in December 2016.  As I told Poppy Harlow on CNN, I want to work with the Trump Administration in a same way to help Flint. I am hoping the White House will respond to my request soon.

"The update was pushed for by Congressman Dan Kildee. He said he decided to pursue the change after ITT Technical Institute, a for profit college with campuses around the nation, suddenly closed in 2016, impacting student veterans across the nation.  After the update passed the House, Republican Rep. Luke Messer said the changes would be a 'big win for our veterans.'"

I'm pleased that the House of Representatives unanimously passed my legislation that expands the Wounded Warrior Fellowship Program. This declaration is important so that residents and business owners can begin to rebuild from this emergency.

I'm happy that the House of Representatives unanimously passed my legislation to expand the Wounded Warrior Fellowship Program. These paid fellowships in Congress give wounded veterans more opportunities to serve their country through public service.

James McCloughan, a 71-year-old Vietnam veteran who lives in west Michigan, will receive the Medal of Honor today for his service as a medic during the Vietnam War. Well deserved recognition for his valor and bravery in combat.

Two great announcements today for Flint, set in motion by our Flint aid package passed by Congress last year and signed into law by former President Obama: → $14.4 million for a Flint lead registry established by Michigan State University and Dr. Mona Hanna-Attisha to ensure that Flint families get access to the care they need to mitigate lead exposure. → $20.7 million in relief for Flint to make much-needed repairs to city's water system.  Ensuring Flint gets the resources it needs to recover from this man-made crisis continues to be one of my top priorities in Congress.

While Congress is out, I'm back home meeting with small businesses and workers to highlight ways that we can grow our economy and create more good-paying jobs. Throughout August, I'll be on a month-long tour highlighting great "made in America" manufacturing happening right here in places like Flint, Saginaw, Bay City and Tawas.  Congress needs to act on a jobs bill and ways we can rebuild our crumbling roads and bridges. Outdated infrastructure hurts businesses and workers competitiveness in a global economy. I’m spending August talking to Michigan workers and small businesses about how we can create better jobs, better wages, and economic opportunity for our entire region.    Congress needs to do a better job of supporting small businesses and manufacturing who are creating jobs here at home. We have to invest in our workers and our crumbling infrastructure to compete in a global economy.   See my stop at GLE Precision in Bridgeport ➡
It’s time for both parties to come together to fix what’s broken in our health care system and improve the Affordable Care Act. Together we can expand access and lower costs for health care.

Next Monday, August 14th, we’re bringing veterans and their families together for a free day of fishing and outdoor activities, including guided kayaking, fly fishing and spin casting! Lunch will be provided. More details below.  I’m proud to partner with State Representative Phil Phelps, Flint River Watershed Coalition, National Professional Anglers Association,  Red Fox Outfitters and Heroes on the Water - Central Michigan to make this event possible in the community.

When it comes to North Korea, we need a smart, strong and unified strategy. Bombastic rhetoric isn't going to deter Kim Jong Un. I'm afraid it may escalate the situation further and lead to a military conflict. Americans don't want to go to war.  Instead, we should work with the global community to apply additional economic pressure through sanctions and increase our pressure on China to stop their trading with North Korea, which counts for almost 90 percent of their total trade. Our veterans and service members deserve real action despite partisan gridlock in Washington. That’s why I’m proud to have worked with Republicans & Democrats to pass legislation that helps our veterans, service members and their families. My legislation protects veterans benefits, housing, and creates more opportunities in public service. Watch here ➡

I’m continuing my jobs tour in Michigan, talking to workers and small business owners about how we can create better jobs and better wages for everyone. Spent the morning working alongside everyone at Bay Plastics Machinery in Bay City and talked about ways we can improve job training, trade and health care. I’ll work with anyone to make sure Michigan workers are getting a fair shake and a better deal.
The racism and bigotry on display in Charlottesville has no place in our society. President Trump needs to immediately and forcefully condemn such hate and violence.

I spent yesterday morning hosting a free fishing event for veterans and their families in Flushing to thank them for their service. Recreational therapy like fishing, kayaking, and other outdoor activities have been shown to have positive benefits in helping veterans cope with PTSD. I was incredibly grateful to share this event with our veterans and their families and enjoy some of the outdoor beauty our great state has to offer.  Thank you to State Representative Phil Phelps, Flint River Watershed Coalition, National Professional Anglers Association, Red Fox Outfitters, Heroes on the Water - Central Michigan, Cabela's & everyone else in the community who made this great event possible.

President Trump has shown his true colors with the embrace of neo-Nazis, white supremacists and hate groups like the KKK. The President's comments calling them "very fine people" are dangerous and only give more oxygen and energy to hate groups. There aren't "two sides" to this debate-- one side marched with Nazi flags, carried torches and drove a car into a crowd of people. It should not be hard to denounce these thugs and their violent behavior that killed a woman.  Whether you are an elected official or private citizen, history will judge us all where we stand during these times. We all have a responsibility to speak up. As Elie Wiesel said, "neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim."   When my children look back, I want to be known as someone who strongly condemned such racism, bigotry and violence.

We’re looking for college students to intern in our Washington D.C. office this fall. Gain college credit and invaluable experience working in our nation’s capital. Apply here ➔ https://dankildee.house.gov/services/internships

I was proud to spend a day in the life of Flint Township firefighter at the same department where my grandfather, E. Jack Maxwell, served as chief for 25 years. His example taught me the value of public service. It was a privilege to honor his memory while learning from Flint Township’s bravest about how they’re serving our community.

Check out my incredible visit to Central Michigan University's College of Medicine facility here in Saginaw. It was a great opportunity to see their commitment to our community and talk about improving health care for our region.

Had a great day touring Ebenezer Ministries’ hoop house garden seeing how locally grown food is revitalizing our community. It was great to speak with young people in their summer youth program to see how employment was making an impact in their lives.

This week, the U.S. Coast Guard from Saginaw are in Texas assisting with Hurricane Harvey relief efforts. I had the privilege of visiting their station to learn more about how they are prepared to conduct rescue operations. I’m grateful for the service of the men and women of our Coast Guard and wish them a safe return from their mission in Texas.

As we remember the hard fought victories of the working men and women who came before us this Labor Day, we must continue the fight for the rights of labor. Unions built the middle class and the American dream. When unions are under attack, so is our way of life, whether you are in a union today or not.

Congress must act to fix our broken immigration system, including passing legislation to protect DREAMers. They were brought to America as children by their parents through no fault of their own. We shouldn't punish them because they haven't done anything wrong.  DREAMers make significant contributions to our economy. Nearly all DREAMers are in the workforce or in school. Our economy stands to lose hundreds of billions of dollars annually if these individuals are deported. That's why business leaders and Republicans have joined Democrats in speaking out in opposition to ending DACA.

Voters should choose their elected officials, not the other way around. I'm proud to join prominent Republicans and Democrats in filing an amicus brief at the Supreme Court today to end partisan gerrymandering once and for all.  Voters rightfully feel discouraged and disenfranchised as gerrymandering continues to distort our politics. The Supreme Court should end partisan gerrymandering, giving power back to the people where it belongs. Read our amicus brief: http://bit.ly/2f54SCg

Due to the recent flooding in mid-Michigan, Bay County residents and small business owners may be eligible for benefits from the FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency and U.S. Small Business Administration.  If you had structural damage caused by the recent flood waters or had flood waters inside your home or business, you must register before October 2, 2017.  Click below for details and more information:
I voted for relief for Hurricane Harvey and Irma victims and am happy to see this bipartisan legislation head to President Trump's desk. As Americans, we come together to help those in crisis.
Today we pause to honor those lost in the horrific September 11, 2001 terrorist attack. We will never forget.

I am pleased that Republicans and Democrats came together in the House of Representatives today to support my legislation expanding important resources for those exposed to lead.  It is critical that Flint families and children get the health care and other resources they need to mitigate the effects of lead exposure. This water crisis is not over.  Learn more about my legislation that passed today:

Despite partisan gridlock in Washington, I’m proud to see Republicans and Democrats come together to pass my legislation that supports youth employment opportunities in mid-Michigan and expands health care services for pregnant women and children exposed to lead.

Great news: The House of Representatives rejected President Trump’s cuts to the Great Lakes! The Great Lakes are job creators that propel our economy. We must fully fund the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative to protect them from harm.  I’m also glad that Republicans and Democrats are supporting my new bill to update federal mapping of the Great Lakes. Updating these maps – some of which have not been updated in two decades – will upgrade our ability to respond to any crisis.

Grateful to have received the Sierra Club's highest award for a public official, the Edgar Wayburn Award, for my work bringing relief to Flint families recovering from the ongoing water crisis.  The fight in Congress to pass a Flint aid package was not easy, but we never stopped pushing until we got it across the finish line. In the richest country in the world, access to safe drinking water should be a right, not a privilege. http://bit.ly/2f2jkKR
NA

Grateful to have spent a day with Meals on Wheels America delivering food to seniors and veterans in Saginaw. Meals on Wheels is a successful program that greatly benefits our community. I will continue to fight against President Trump's budget cuts to this essential program that brings food and companionship to many that need it across Michigan.

At General Motors' Flint Truck Assembly, helping to work the line with my brothers and sisters of UAW Local 598. Had a great discussion about how we can create better jobs, wages and opportunity for Flint and all of Michigan. Thanks to the hardworking men and women of the UAW International Union who make the best cars and trucks in the world!  I’ll work with anyone in Congress to make sure that Flint, and so many communities like it across the nation, have fair trade deals, a skilled workforce and the infrastructure needed to compete in the global economy.

Speaker Ryan should bring the DREAM Act to the floor so that we can have an up or down vote. If we can get the bill to the floor, I know Republicans and Democrats will vote to protect DREAMers.  That's why I've also signed a discharge petition that could force an immediate vote on this important bill. The discharge petition needs 218 signers to force a vote. http://bit.ly/2xLIXu4

I'm all for simplifying our tax code and making it more fair for middle class families. But I will not support more tax breaks for the wealthiest Americans.  Unfortunately, the Republican plan gives the biggest breaks to the ultra-rich. Their plan ends the estate tax, giving a $269 billion tax break to just 5,400 rich families, including the Trump and DeVos families. Even worse, they don't say how they will pay for these tax cuts.  Giving billionaires a massive tax break is fiscally irresponsible and unfair to the families I represent. http://bit.ly/2fyHfFW
Heartbreaking news out of Las Vegas. My condolences go to those killed and wounded in this horrific attack.

Voters should pick their elected officials, not the other way around. Manipulating districts to favor one political party is wrong and is dangerous to our democracy.  That’s why I’m joining Republicans and Democrats in urging the Supreme Court to end partisan gerrymandering. The High Court can put power back in the hands of the people by ruling gerrymandered maps as unconstitutional. Learn more:

According to the non-partisan Tax Policy Center, the biggest winner under the Republican tax plan "would be the richest 1 percent of U.S. taxpayers," while middle class families "would see a tax increase over 10 years."  Middle class families should be the focus of any tax relief, not the richest Americans. http://bit.ly/2fyHfFW

I joined members of both parties at the Supreme Court today to call for an end partisan gerrymandering.   Letting politicians draw their own districts makes no sense. Every American should have fair representation. http://bit.ly/2xQUN40

I am proud to announce a new federal grant for Flint to help reduce crime and create safer streets.  Excited to see the collaboration between Hamilton Community Health Network  and the City of Flint Police Department to help strengthen our neighborhoods.  See more:

The House Oversight Committee must look into Gov. Snyder's potentially misleading statements about when he learned of the Legionnaires' outbreak in Flint. A top state official today testified in court that the Governor knew sooner about the outbreak than he has previously acknowledged, including in the Governor's sworn testimony before Congress.  People have to tell the truth when they testify before Congress. No one is above the law and misleading Congress is a very serious offense.
It's game day! Team Kildee is divided, but we're proud to represent both schools. Ready for some football today!

As the next round of NAFTA renegotiation talks began today, I stood with workers to say that our country needs fair trade deals that benefit American workers, not multi-national corporations.  Any so-called free trade deal must create good-paying American jobs and raise the wages of all workers. If it doesn't meet those high standards, I'll oppose it, just like I have under Democratic and Republican Presidents who have tried to rush bad free trade deals through Congress.
Tomorrow at 8:45 a.m. ET, I'll be on Morning Joe. Hope you can tune in!

I’ve been talking to my constituents about their health care and they’re concerned about President Trump’s decision that will raise their premiums.  I’m willing to work with Republicans and Democrats in Congress to find ways to lower premiums and increase access to affordable care. As I told Morning Joe, we need bipartisan solutions that work for everyone.
Middle class families should be the focus of any tax relief, not the richest Americans.  Read my Detroit News column today:
It was great to have my good friend Congressman Joe Kennedy III in Flint to give him an update on the water crisis recovery efforts and show him how resilient our community is.

I was honored to deliver the keynote address at the James O’Neill Jr. Memorial Lecture at Saginaw Valley State University about the importance of public service and promoting bipartisanship in politics.  Both parties need to work together to promote job growth, increase workers’ wages and ensure access to affordable health care. http://www.valleyvanguardonline.com/congressman-dan-kildee-gives-lecture-on-bipartisanship-civility/

Incredible night at the Flint movie viewing in Washington D.C. with Lifetime UK, continuing to tell the stories of Flint and highlight the resources families need to recover from the ongoing water crisis.  In the richest country in the world, access to safe drinking water should be a right not a privilege. I’ll keep fighting so that Flint has the help it needs to recover. I’m proud to have leaders like Keith Ellison & Senator Debbie Stabenow with me in that fight.
NA

Equifax executives must be held accountable for the massive data breach that affected 145 million Americans. I’ve heard from my constituents about how difficult it was navigating Equifax’s bureaucracy just to protect their personal data, making it hard for millions of Americans to fix a problem that Equifax created.  Equifax failed to provide the necessary resources to my constituents to protect them from identity theft and other harm for free. I also believe that Equifax executives must come before Congress to testify whether they benefited from illegal insider trading while charging millions of Americans to safeguard their personal information.  The American people deserve answers from Equifax.

Proud to honor the heroes of the Flint Bishop attack. I have known Lieutenant Neville for years and he is a true public servant. Lieutenant Neville, Chief Chris Miller and Richard Krul showed true acts of courage that prevented the attacker from harming others. The congressional resolution I introduced is a small act of gratitude to those who keep our community safe.

Today’s charges against two top Trump aides are serious and unprecedented. The crimes alleged underscore the importance and gravity of special counsel Mueller’s investigation.  It is critical that special counsel Mueller be able to continue his investigation without interference, including from the President or his administration. This ongoing investigation should follow the facts, wherever they may lead. http://bit.ly/2gO5RHx

I'm working with Republicans and Democrats to close the bump stock loophole and give law enforcement the ability to keep these dangerous devices out of the hands of criminals and violent people.   Read more about my new bill: http://bit.ly/2gZG3vG

Starting today, Michiganders can get quality and affordable health insurance through the insurance market place.  Many Michigan families last year qualified for financial help with their premiums when they enrolled through the market place.  It's quick and easy to sign up. Make sure to visit www.healthcare.gov to sign up for health care or renew your plan before December 15th.

How can Congress better serve communities like Flint, Saginaw and Bay City? That's the focus of my forum on Capitol Hill today with Congressman Brian Higgins as part of my "The Future of America's Cities and Towns" initiative.

I’m proud to have worked to make sure Sergeant First Class Corder received the benefits he deserved. We must take care of our veterans who put their lives on the line to serve our country.   I’m committed to continuing support of our service members and veterans. If you believe you are being treated unfairly, my office is here to help.  http://bit.ly/2zeDOv9

Our veterans selflessly served our country and it's important for us to honor their service. This Veterans Day, join me for a town hall in Flint to listen to their stories. All community members are welcome. RSVP here https://dankildee.house.gov/veteransdaytownhall
Join me in Flint for a Veterans Day Town Hall to honor those who served.

After the deadliest mass shooting in modern history, it’s time for Congress to act to protect American families.    My bipartisan bill, the Close the Bump Stock Loophole Act, is a common sense way to get these dangerous bump stocks off the streets.

The Republican billionaires first tax plan raises taxes on many middle classes families to pay for massive giveaways to the richest 1%. It’s time for tax relief for working families, not more handouts to billionaires.

Americans deserve real tax reform, not a rigged system that puts billionaires first. The winners under the Republican tax plan are corporations and the richest 1%.  I’m fighting for a fairer tax code for middle class families, not more handouts for billionaires.

It was great to be at the Ferris Wheel grand opening in Flint today! This project exemplifies Flint’s resilience and brings fresh business ideas to our city.  I love this project because it shows people around the world that those of us in Flint aim high, and that this is a community worth investing in. http://bit.ly/2yAf8yh
I’m fighting to make sure every veteran in our community gets the benefits they’ve earned.
Middle class families should be the focus of any tax relief, not the richest Americans. Read my MLive.com column.  http://bit.ly/2zKLA1e

It’s important that we recognize and listen to our veterans. Tomorrow, I’m honoring those in our community who served by hosting a Veterans Day Town Hall in Flint. Join us: https://dankildee.house.gov/veteransdaytownhall
Proud to spend Veterans Day with those who served. It was honor to hear their stories. Thank you to everyone in the community who came together to support our veterans.

Every community deserves access to clean drinking water. I talked with NPR about how we can act to protect public health and prevent another tragedy like the Flint water crisis from happening elsewhere. There is no safe level of lead in drinking water, which is why I am fighting for a lead-free water system.  Listen here: http://n.pr/2zzox8V

The facts are clear: Republicans want to raise taxes on millions of middle class families to give billionaires and multi-national corporations a $1.5 trillion tax break.  We can't afford to saddle our children with trillions more in debt to pay for this tax scam that overwhelmingly benefits the wealthiest Americans.

We are fortunate to have the YMCA of Greater Flint in our community. Kyle Kuzma’s story is another shining example of the great work they do every day to provide more opportunity for local area youth.   If given the opportunity, our kids can grow up to do whatever they put their minds to. That’s why I will continue to fight for funding for after school programs and great organizations like the YMCA.
Let us pause this holiday to count our blessings and give thanks. I hope everyone has a great day with family and friends. Happy Thanksgiving!

I want real bipartisan tax relief for middle class families in Michigan.  However, I can't support any tax plan that raises taxes on many middle class families, all to give tax cuts to the richest Americans and big multi-national corporations.  Congress should start over and focus on the middle class, not the richest 1% of Americans.

For decades, Rep Sandy Levin has fought for fair trade deals, affordable health care, and the rights of workers everywhere. His contributions will be evident for a long time.   To have the opportunity to serve with Sandy in Congress has been an incredible honor. http://bit.ly/2AlASxq
I'm live now talking about why Congress should act to help update aging water systems across America. Join the conversation:
Happy Hanukkah to families in Michigan and across the country celebrating tonight! Blessings be with you this festival of lights.

Did you know that many Michigan families qualify for financial help with their health insurance premiums when they enroll through the market place?  It's quick and easy to sign up. Make sure to visit www.healthcare.gov to sign up for health care or renew your plan before Friday's deadline!

Important Update: the FCC will vote tomorrow on net neutrality. Their decision could mean that big corporations have the power to slow down, control or block internet access. Ending net neutrality would hurt individuals, small businesses and entrepreneurs.   I’m fighting for a fair and open internet. Do you support net neutrality? Speak up and take my survey: http://bit.ly/2nWcQEA

The FCC just voted to eliminate net neutrality rules that have kept the internet open, accessible and affordable to all. This bad decision gives big corporations the power to slow down or control your internet speeds, including charging you more for access.  If we can't convince President Trump's FCC on this issue, then I believe Congress must act to protect net neutrality as soon as possible.

I support true bipartisan tax reform that simplifies our tax code and gives real relief to middle class families. Unfortunately, the bill passed in the House today raises taxes on many working families, which is why I voted against it. http://bit.ly/2BJnBjA

This Christmas, I am grateful for my family and friends, and for the honor to represent you in Congress. I hope your holiday is filled with love and laughter. To families celebrating across Michigan—Merry Christmas!
NA
